originalText: Seven members of Parliament in the United Kingdom resigned from the Labour Party to form a new political party called The Independent Group.
subtitle: Member of Parliament (United Kingdom)

originalText: A series of violent events (pictured) involving protesters, riot police, and unknown shooters began in Kyiv that culminated in the ousting of Ukrainian president Viktor Yanukovych five days later.
subtitle: Revolution of Dignity

originalText: Eight gunmen stole US$50,000,000 worth of diamonds from a Swiss-bound aircraft at Brussels Airport.
subtitle: Brussels Airport diamond heist

originalText: In a coup d'état, military rebels attacked the presidential palace in Niamey, Niger, and replaced President Mamadou Tandja with a ruling junta, the Supreme Council for the Restoration of Democracy.
subtitle: 2010 Nigerien coup d'état

originalText: WikiLeaks published the first of hundreds of thousands of classified documents disclosed by Chelsea Manning.
subtitle: WikiLeaks

originalText: American FBI agent Robert Hanssen (pictured) was arrested for having spied for the KGB and GRU over a 22-year period.
subtitle: Federal Bureau of Investigation

originalText: Inter-ethnic violence between the Dayak and the Madurese broke out in Sampit, Indonesia, ultimately causing more than 500 deaths and the displacement of 100,000 Madurese from their homes.
subtitle: Sampit conflict

originalText: NASA's first Space Shuttle, Enterprise, made its first test flight on top of the Shuttle Carrier Aircraft (both pictured).
subtitle: NASA

originalText: The Xinjiang 61st Regiment Farm fire started during Chinese New Year when a firecracker ignited the wreaths of late Mao Zedong, killing 694 personnel.
subtitle: Xinjiang 61st Regiment Farm fire

originalText: President Harry S. Truman signed the Rescission Act, annulling benefits payable to Filipino troops who fought for the U.S. during World War II.
subtitle: Harry S. Truman

originalText: Joseph Goebbels, the Nazi propaganda minister, delivered a speech calling for a "total war" to motivate the German people as the tide of World War II turned against Germany.
subtitle: Joseph Goebbels

originalText: The core members of the White Rose, an anti-Nazi resistance group, were arrested by the Gestapo.
subtitle: White Rose

originalText: Competition between two American merchants in Lincoln County, New Mexico Territory, turned into a range war when a member of one faction was murdered by the other.
subtitle: Lincoln County, New Mexico

originalText: Vasil Levski, a national hero of Bulgaria, was executed in Sofia by the Ottoman authorities for his efforts to establish an independent Bulgarian republic.
subtitle: Vasil Levski

originalText: War of the Sixth Coalition: French troops led by Napoleon forced the Army of Bohemia to retreat after it advanced dangerously close to Paris .
subtitle: War of the Sixth Coalition

originalText: Fourth Anglo-Dutch War: A British expedition against Dutch colonial outposts on the Gold Coast of Africa landed in Elmina in present-day Ghana.
subtitle: Fourth Anglo-Dutch War

originalText: Enslaved Malagasy captives on the Dutch East India Company slave ship Meermin began a mutiny that led to the ship's destruction on Cape Agulhas in present-day South Africa and the recapture of the instigators.
subtitle: Malagasy peoples

originalText: Eighty Years' War: Off the coast of Cornwall, a Spanish fleet intercepted an Anglo-Dutch merchant convoy of forty-four vessels escorted by six men-of-war, destroying or capturing twenty ships.
subtitle: Eighty Years' War

originalText: The Battle of Wesenberg took place between Novgorodian and Pskovian forces against the Livonian Order and its allies, ending with Russian forces retreating from Danish Estonia.
subtitle: Battle of Wesenberg (1268)

originalText: According to Hindu scriptures, Kali Yuga, the last of the four stages that the world goes through as part of the cycle of yugas, began.
subtitle: 4th millennium BC
